definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech
to seek common ground, putting differences aside (idiom)

sentences.english: We should seek common ground and properly handle differences.
sentences.chinese: 我們要求同存異，妥善處理分歧。

sentences.english: Under such circumstances, it is best for us to seek common ground while reserving differences.
sentences.chinese: 這樣的情況下，求同存異就是最好的做法。

sentences.english: They are consensus-driven, with full divergence and then convergence.
sentences.chinese: 他們是共識驅動的，並求同存異。

sentences.english: If the differences between us are only a matter of understanding, we can shelve them and try to find common ground.
sentences.chinese: 如果只是認識上有分歧，可以求同存異。

sentences.english: Differentiations of culture happen all the time as well.
sentences.chinese: 求同存異也一直在發生。

sentences.english: It involves a reputation of equality, especially in seeking common ground while accepting the existing difference.
sentences.chinese: 這與平等的信譽有關，尤其是在求同存異的時候。

sentences.english: Let us seek common ground while putting aside differences, enhance mutual understanding and trust, and strength exchange and cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們求同存異，增進理解與信任，加強交流與合作。

sentences.english: The store is characterized by the simultaneous need for sameness and difference.
sentences.chinese: 該建築的特徵是“求同”和“存異”一同出現。

sentences.english: Fourth, we need to seek common ground while shelving difference and enhance common security.
sentences.chinese: 第四，堅持求同存異，促進共同安全。

definition: to rent a place with sb else to share the costs
to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
name and address of the sender enclosed/details inside
phonetic a, similar to 呵/-azine, see 吖嗪[a1 qin2]
(slang) (used at the end of a sentence to mimic Korean speech) (loanword from Korean verb ending "seumnida")/(jocularly) a Korean
(Internet slang) friend (pun on 朋友[peng2 you3])
